title-group.article-title: Jack Spicer's Ghosts and the Immemorial Community

abstract.p: Jack Spicer's poetry is not a pursuit of the ideal of community, but rather his work is an instance of community. One of the most significant aspects of a community is its relationship to, and communication with, the dead. This essay explores Spicer's relationship to the dead poet Garcia Lorca through his book After Lorca, and Lorca's relationship to the immemorial community in Textbook of Poetry.
